Reviews.Title: “Great location, manageable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pshaq47
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on the returning part of my trip to the states. Great transition from cottage to hotel. 11 had solid television, great room service and mini bar, impeccable location and fabulous service. Perfectly situated for kings road shopping. Walking distance to Choys!!!

Reviews.Title: “The new owners have a lot of work to do”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: The Cadogan Estate paid a lot of money for this hotel but has a lot more to spend if it is to live up to the hype on its website. I was booked in here by a business associate who seems to like the place - goodness knows why. Vastly overpriced and not at all the "home from home" in London that it would like to call itself. Staff were disinterested at best and surly at worst. No chance that we will use this place again.

Reviews.Title: “I wish we'd never set foot in this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Moominsaz
Reviews.Content: We had the worst experience with this hotel and would strongly advise anyone to avoid it. To explain…. We went to view the hotel in February 2010 as a possible venue for our wedding reception. Contrary to many reviewers on here we actually really liked the décor and fell in love with the place. The then Food and Beverage Manager was an absolute delight and couldn't do enough to help us achieve what we hoped within our budget. We spent several months working with him to develop a menu and specification for the day, including all the little personal touches we dreamed of. Everything seemed perfect, so we went ahead and booked the date. Much correspondence followed to confirm all the details in writing, and all that remained was to pay the deposit, which he suggested holding back until our ceremony venue was confirmed, in case of a date change. We were a little concerned after a fire at Easter, and disappointed that the lounge was not redecorated as promised to the same luxurious finish. Still, everywhere else was the same and we remained very excited about our special day. Once our ceremony venue was confirmed, we immediately instructed No 11 to take our deposit and then we painstakingly hand made and sent out 180 invitations. We were initially a little alarmed when the Food and Beverage Manager, who we had been dealing with regularly for many, many months, suddenly left out of the blue, with only a few days notice. We were even more concerned to discover that our deposit had not actually been taken. However, we were relieved when his temporary replacement confirmed that he had given her everything we agreed in writing, which would of course would be honoured, and our deposit was to be taken immediately. A few days later we were contacted by the Manager, who proceeded to renege on almost everything we had agreed. Despite an extensive email trail with proof of authorisation of all the details of the booking, the hotel essentially broke contract and refused to honour most of it. The Manager’s attitude was extraordinary and she was extremely rude and patronising. We immediately arranged a meeting with her to try and sort out the situation. It soon became clear that she was related to the owner, had no concept of customer service and next to no experience of running any kind of event. She had decided to hold this difficult meeting in the public lounge in front of several other guests – presumably to make us feel very uncomfortable. She succeeded – it was very strange and terribly embarrassing for both us and the other hotel guests who overheard the entire conversation. Despite our efforts to understand her point of view and compromise so we could move forward, she adamantly refused to discuss anything other than a new, non-negotiable contract which was far-removed from our initial brief and financially unrealistic in view of the agreed budget. With communications broken down between us, and naturally feeling we could no longer be objective about the situation, my close friend, who is very experienced in these matters and lives in the local area, then visited the hotel to see if she could help in any way. She was told the Manager was in a meeting but my friend said she was happy to wait until she was finished. Having waited over an hour to see her, being constantly told that she would be a few minutes, she was finally informed that the Manager had left for the day. (Obviously via the back door to avoid passing my friend in the lobby.) At this point, we could only wonder just what the wedding would have been like if it had gone ahead under her instruction. With only 8 weeks to the wedding and Christmas in the middle too, the Manager gave us the choice of finding another c£5K or walking away. We were left with no option but to go elsewhere; a very embarrassing situation in light of the fact we had sent out all the invitations a month before. I cannot begin to describe the stress, disappointment and fear we experienced and I still have nightmares about it even now. Thankfully, we did find another venue and our wedding was absolutely beautiful. However, this was no thanks to No 11. My advice is that this is a shoddy, over-priced, poorly run outfit with no concern for customer service or reputation. Our biggest lesson and strongest regret is that we didn’t listen to the countless negative reviews on this site beforehand. We're still considering legal action as we are informed we have a very strong case - the only reason we haven’t yet gone ahead is that don't want to mar the memory of our (eventual) dream wedding that we very nearly didn't get!

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: fitness1972
Reviews.Content: I stay in many 5* apartments and hotesl in London and thought I would try this hotel. Firstly, I can agree with others that the rooms are so tired and the carpets are dirty, the bathrooms are so small and dated and you can't swing a cat in the bedrooms and we had the room one down from the suite! God help the people in the standard rooms. We were charged £380 including VAT and the air conditioning in the room didn't work, nor did we have a remote for our TV (and they failed to get us one despite numerous requests) I had the worst night sleep in a long time as we had to open the curtains to try and get some air into the room, yes you can imagine July in London and no air con....There was no concierge when we arrived, he was sick apparently, not my problem when they charge this much so we had to park our own car. The staff seem totally disconcerned and indifferent as to whether we were there or not which I found disguisting. The only saving grace was the manager on duty was up when I dragged my bones downstairs at 7am to the gym as failed to sleep well and I told her how unhappy we were. It didn't seem to go in so I walked off in the end, then when I came back up she was still there and she was very apologetic with me and has asked me to come back complimentary which I will do, if only to hope the whole experience improves greatly. It will need to for me to pay to stay again. I can say the gym is ideal for a quick workout and its on site and the downstairs rooms are great if you are meeting a client which I was.

Reviews.Title: “one of the most beautiful hotels i've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: ... and I've stayed in a few beautiful ones! The public areas are sumptuous and decadent modern-baroque â€“ plush fabrics and gorgeous chandeliers â€“ and the bar, along the same lines, is probably the most beautiful bar Iâ€™ve ever had the pleasure of visiting. In contrast the restaurant is monochrome and has a more classic style, but is no less beautiful in its own way. We stayed in the wonderfully sexy Balfour Suite. No.11 thoroughly deserves its Hot Pink rating on the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “A la recherche du temps perdu”
Reviews.Author: Aubrey999
Reviews.Content: I have was a client of Number 11 for over 20 years --before it's sale to a hotel chain in 2008. It was truly my London home away from home, I was invariably greeted by name and I knew the name of all the regular staff; I was afforded a special rate even though I would not qualify for one if the math of a chain were applied; I was regularly upgraded to a larger room if the hotel was not full. In sum: I was welcomed as a valued guest in deeds, not just words. During those two decades, in return, I recmmended Number 11 to hundreds of friends and associates. A few months ago, I decided I would give the new regime a chance. What I found was an overpriced, underserviced and somewhat tacky caricature of this noble house's former glory. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Rather poor”
Reviews.Author: mn33
Reviews.Content: Decided to go to No 11 because of its excellent location. Read that the hotel had some bad reviews here on tripadvisor and used my normal source Hautecompass, which rated it relatively high and said it was quirky, well too quirky for me. DonÂ´t go here if you are looking for a luxury hotel, this one is certainly not!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a weekend in london”
Reviews.Author: Rignana
Reviews.Content: Had to travel to London for a birthday party and another event. Know the hotel very well, excellent service as always, great food, barman makes the best cocktails, and breakfast in bed is the best. I hosted an impromptu drinks party for 10 people in the drawing room and the staf did not bat an eyelid and were so helpful. Cannot believe the bad reviews, obviously those people should be staying the Holiday Inn, the have no taste or idea of style!

Reviews.Title: “please ignore the voices of doom below”
Reviews.Author: euanmchardy
Reviews.Content: just had the romance package 21st aug 2010, could not have had a better time, room spotless, food excellent, service brilliant, we were well looked after; Dont know what hotel was like before the new owners took over,but want to go back, and would reccommend to anyone for business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and friendly”
Reviews.Author: londonlover11
Reviews.Content: I dont agree to any of the below, ive had a fantastic stay at this hotel and service was 100%. It really felt like visiting someones home. i would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mytra1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Number 11 for over 20 years it is with regret that I can no longer recommend this hotel to anyone. It used to be a top-notch townhouse-hotel with traditional English decor and ambiance. With new ownership and decor it has turned into a disaster. The public areas look as a New Orleans bordello might have appeared a hundred years ago (without the girls). Nothing English or classy about this. A few of the rooms have been renovated (the more expensive ones) but the majority are worn and very disappointing. None of the rooms at Number 11 are sound-proofed and the night staff fails to keep the noise level down without a special request. The recent renovations to this hotel have consisted of redecorating only without changes to the infrastructure. The breakfast room walls are covered with garish black-and-white framed photocopies of photos of social misfits from the 1970's. The breakfast buffet is poor to mediocre. It used to be the best around. The staff in the dining room area spent most of the time standing around complaining about their poor work conditions. The room prices here are way too high for what one receives. A poor value to be avoided. Another reviewer wrote that a staff member told her the new owner was trying to attract a "different kind of clientele". Good luck. You certainly won't be seeing this customer back again.

Reviews.Title: “no wonder the room images are so tightly croppped!”
Reviews.Author: Rob_fr_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: I am in London each month for business and generally stay at the Hilton London Paddington. Because occupancy was so tight (Farnborough Air Show was on), I was unable to find a room at any of my usual suspects. I found No11 online and looked lovely. On arrival, the could not find my reservation!! Thankfully, I had my confirmation with me and after some searching they found it. The first room I was given was shocking! dirty carpets - dull bathroom - clearly NOTHING LIKE the website had visually promised. Finally after some poking around in their system, they were able to find me a slightly larger room but still it bears no resemblance to the website. (think dutch plates and you will be able to visualise the wallpaper. Odd furnishings and carpets that are in dire need of a deep clean. The lesson learned here...... If the website has those little vinette images and nothing more... run for the hills!

Reviews.Title: “..not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: SwissWI
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at No 11 for several times over the past 10 years. Although at our last stay in 2007 the hotel seemed to be a little run down we had a very nice air conditioned room on one of the upper floors. Now this latest stay was our first after the owner change and partial renovation. First surprise was that our request to get the room we had before absolutely unknown to the staff at the reception. Second one was that the really pleasant afternoon tea has gone and the cosy reading place with a real fire in the fireplace has been replaced by a dark Russian style bar with freezing air conditioning. Third we were woken up in the morning by the construction worker outside of our 2nd floor room. I just could continue to count on unpleasant things (such as that one out of three times newspapers made it to our room door, or the dried down salmon and cheese in the breakfast room). Also there was a very unpleasant smoky smell throughout the hotel and especially in our bathroom which hat a window to a tiny inner court. The only really positive point was that the very helpful stuff (besides the ladies at the reception) made it through owner change and renovation! We are seriously re-thinking to look for another home from home in London.... what a pity, since No 11 is in such a perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: kannm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in June. I don't think tripadvisor had updated it from the prior hotel at the location (11 Cadogan) so I didn't review it at the time. We absolutely loved the location, and walked to a lovely dinner. My husband had the breakfast and thought it was exceptional. I know I am in the minority here, but I loved the decor of the common areas. They are pretty lightly staffed, so service is a little hands off (as others have noted) but they gave us a wonderful list of local restaurants and attractions which was very helpful. The real major downside was the rooms, we had (what had to be) a yet to be renovated room. To be polite, I will leave it as I was not at all impressed with the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “classy, comfortable, luxurious, full of character, yet not 100% for service”
Reviews.Author: Coffeecreme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at No.11 with my husband for one night after a day trip on the Orient Express British Pullman. The whole purpose of staying in such an expensive hotel was to have a relaxing and luxurious time for a special occasion (my husbands 40th). It's very cosy, we loved the decor and our room (no 006) was very comfortable and VERY peaceful considering it was on the ground floor, and in central London. The room was described as a suite but was really just a reasonable sized room with a large enough table to eat a meal at, and a with very luxurious marble bathroom. The hotel advertises its spa facilities, but these are booked with outside therapists. We had booked a massage and reflexology treatment to finish off our day out and set the mood for a relaxing evening. The therapists arrived at the hotel dead on the time we had booked and we went down to the basement treatment rooms. My treatment room was fine but my husband said his was very basic with no music. Neither of the therapists were qualified to do reflexology so that was a big disappointment as it is my favourite spa treatment so I had to settle for a massage, not wanting to make a fuss and spoil the mood. The treatments were perfectly adequate but it was a real shame that I couldn't have the treatment I had booked. We ordered breakfast in our room the next morning. First of all they had forgotten our newspaper, then when they brought the breakfast, had forgotten the fruit salad, and they brought about 20 slices of toast and only one tiny square of butter. Our final bugbear was that they had valet-parked our car for us when we arrived but when we checked out we were told no-one was available to collect our car and we had to walk to the car park (a totally separate, NCP-type carpark) which was a few minutes walk away. The total bill, for one night, breakfast, no evening meal but just one club sandwich, bottle of champagne, two spa treatments and car parking came to Â£800. And of course there was an extra charge on our bill for the breakfast which should not have been there, as it was included in our room tariff. This has happened to us in every posh hotel we have ever stayed in. My advice is - check the bill! I feel the whole experience was let down slightly by the service, from not booking the correct treatment, to having to get up 3 times during breakfast to let the waiter in, to having to collect the car from a car park some distance away. The hotel did not appear at all busy, we barely saw any other residents whilst there.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: aceexec
Reviews.Content: i am also looking for hotel as currently staying in '11 London' and it's been a nightmare since i checked in - i have a large suite with VERY unusual decor - moose heads etc, it's VERY dark even with all the lights on. (i appreciate al this is personal choice) the phone in the room doesn't work, i had to ask reception to give me a phone! (they said cause recent renovation it's still not installed correctly (why was i not informed of this before arriving!) i had to ask housekeeping for light bulbs as the bedside lamps didn't work. also, this morning i asked for 7.30am wake up call, they called me 7.50! and there was NO HOT WATER! they said 'we've a plumber working on it!!!!) when they came to clean my room, it was VERY basic clean! (make bed and re-hang towels!!!) then today, while working on my laptop a member of staff just came walking into my room (no knock or anything!) he claimed to re-fil mini bar. aaahhhhh! and i've not even had an apology so far! fyi i'm paying GBP600 per night!!!!! do NOT stay here!! still so so so much teething problems!

HotelInfo.Name: No 11 Private Members Club
HotelInfo.Address: 11 Cadogan Gardens | Sloane Square, Chelsea, London SW3 2RJ, England
